Tuning.description: A block for managing all frequency-related settings.

Quick Span.description: A block for managing all frequency-related presets.

1.description: So tight you'll feel like a cellular biologist examining a single-cell waveform.

2.description: A narrow, focused view for getting up close and personal with signals.

3.description: The standard span, a balanced diet for most common analysis.

4.description: A broad, digestible view of the spectrum, great for general reconnaissance.

5.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range. It's like scanning with a wide-angle lens.

6.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range.

7.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range. It's like scanning with a wide-angle lens.

UNSELECTED.description: No span option is currently selected.

1.description: So tight you'll feel like a cellular biologist examining a single-cell waveform.

2.description: A narrow, focused view for getting up close and personal with signals.

3.description: The standard span, a balanced diet for most common analysis.

4.description: A broad, digestible view of the spectrum, great for general reconnaissance.

5.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range. It's like scanning with a wide-angle lens.

6.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range.

7.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range. It's like scanning with a wide-angle lens.

UNSELECTED.description: No span option is currently selected.

1.description: Like a race car: fast sweep, low detail. Best for catching fleeting signals.

2.description: A jog through the spectrum; quick enough to see the sights without missing much.

3.description: The perfect balance of speed and fidelity. Not too fast, not too slow.

4.description: A calm stroll, giving you time to appreciate the finer signal details.

5.description: A slow saunter through the noise floor, where every waveform is a work of art.

6.description: For the patient scientist. You'll see things nobody else can, but it'll take a while.

7.description: So slow you can practically see the electrons move. The highest fidelity, but you'll miss any quick events.

8.description: So slow you can practically see the electrons move. The highest fidelity, but you'll miss any quick events.

UNSELECTED.description: No resolution bandwidth option is currently selected.

1.description: A lightning-fast sweep. Filters are wide open, letting everything through.

2.description: A quick pass through the spectrum, ideal for fast-changing signals.

3.description: A balanced speed for general purpose monitoring and signal capture.

4.description: The standard filter setting for most common analysis tasks. Not too much, not too little.

5.description: A gentle filter, giving you more time to appreciate the finer details of a waveform.

6.description: For the meticulous scientist. You'll filter out fast noise and jitter, but at the cost of speed.

7.description: A meditative pace. So slow you can practically see the electrons move, offering maximum stability and noise reduction.

8.description: A slow crawl. Good for very detailed analysis of continuous signals and filtering out transient noise.

9.description: A slow crawl. Good for very detailed analysis of continuous signals and filtering out transient noise.

10.description: The scanner cries, but it's worth it. Filters out almost all random noise, giving you a crystal-clear, steady line.

11.description: The scanner cries, but it's worth it. Filters out almost all random noise, giving you a crystal-clear, steady line.

12.description: Time seems to stop. For the most patient scientists and signals with incredible stability. The ultimate low-pass filter.

13.description: Time seems to stop. For the most patient scientists and signals with incredible stability. The ultimate low-pass filter.

UNSELECTED.description: No video bandwidth option is currently selected.

examplefields.notes: Bipolar pitch shift with fader and fine-tune dial.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/composite/Horizonta.notes: Volume control with fader for coarse, dial for fine adjustment.
Volume control with fader for coarse, dial for fine adjustment.
Volume control with fader for coarse, dial for fine adjustment.
Delay time control with fader (seconds) and dial (milliseconds).
Delay time control with fader (seconds) and dial (milliseconds).
Delay time control with fader (seconds) and dial (milliseconds).
Reverb decay control, integer steps only (dial will be inactive).
Reverb decay control, integer steps only (dial will be inactive).
Reverb decay control, integer steps only (dial will be inactive).
Bipolar pitch shift with fader and fine-tune dial.
Bipolar pitch shift with fader and fine-tune dial.
Bipolar pitch shift with fader and fine-tune dial.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/composite/slider_va.notes: A standard horizontal slider with numerical input for volume control.
Slider for fine-tuning gain, bipolar range with dB units.
Slider for selecting frequency, wide range.
Slider for adjusting delay time in seconds.

examplefields.notes: Custom fader for controlling modulation depth.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/audio/custom_fader/.notes: Custom fader for main volume control.
Logarithmic fader suitable for audio gain control, emphasizing lower values.
A shorter fader with custom defined tick marks.
A custom fader for adjusting filter cutoff frequency.
Custom fader for controlling modulation depth.

examplefields.notes: Fader with custom sized and shaped handle.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/audio/custom_horizo.notes: Standard horizontal pan fader, linear response, centered.
Logarithmic horizontal fader for wide frequency ranges.
Compact horizontal fader with custom tick marks and smaller handle.
Horizontal fader for delay time, value displayed statically.
Fader with custom sized and shaped handle.

examplefields.notes: Dial for controlling a process, starting at a high value.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/audio/dial/elements.notes: A standard dial for continuous control, 0-999 range.
Dial representing a position or index value.
Larger dial for selecting a time value within a range.
Small dial with a specific reference point.
Dial for controlling a process, starting at a high value.

examplefields.notes: Vertical fader for compressor threshold setting.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/audio/fader/element.notes: Horizontal fader for stereo panning, centered at 0.
Vertical gain fader with a +/- 12dB range.
Fader for controlling the balance between dry and wet signals.
Vertical fader for compressor threshold setting.

examplefields.notes: Drive knob with a high default setting.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/audio/knob/elements.notes: Knob for fine-tuning pitch, bipolar range.
Large knob for filter cutoff frequency.
Small pan knob with a center detent (reff_point).
Drive knob with a high default setting.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/audio/needle_vu_met.notes: A classic needle VU meter display.
A larger needle VU meter with an extended range.
A compact needle VU meter for individual channel monitoring.
Needle meter configured for a wider decibel range.
Needle meter showing a value close to the red zone initially.

OPEN-AIR/Petting_Zoo/audio/Linear_Travel.notes: Custom fader for main volume control.

examplefields.notes: Link to a relevant blog post.

Input field for entering search queries.

Input field for a general description.

examplefields.notes: Example of a value box for sensitive input (visual only).
